TESTOSTERONE

ANDROGENS

  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Medicinal forms

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Suppression of spermatogenesis,

Directions for administration

With buccal use

Place rounded side of tablet on gum above front teeth and hold lip firmly over the gum for 30 seconds. If tablet detaches within 4 hours of next dose, replace with new tablet which is considered the second dose for the day.

With topical use

Avoid skin contact with gel application sites to prevent testosterone transfer to other people, especially pregnant women and children—consult product literature.

Advice for patients and carers

With buccal use

Patient or carer should be given advice on how to administer testosterone buccal tablets.

With transdermal use

Patient or carer should be given advice on how to administer testosterone gel.

Prepared medicinal forms of TESTOSTERONE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: ointment, implant, transdermal patch,
Transdermal patch
Gel
